items.title: MAJORS II: HCO+& HCN Abundances in W40
items.summary: arXiv:2601.19971v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present observations of HCN and HCO$^+$ J = $3 - 2$ in the central $424'' \times 424''$ region of the W40 massive star forming region. The observations were taken as part of a pilot project for the MAJORS large program at the JCM…

items.title: A constrained linear model for continuum normalization of stellar spectra

items.title: An X-ray-Emitting Proto-Cluster at $z\approx5.7$ Reveals Rapid Structure Growth
items.summary: arXiv:2601.19978v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Galaxy clusters are the most massive gravitationally bound structures in the universe and serve as tracers of the assembly of large-scale structure. Studying their progenitors, proto-clusters, sheds light on the earliest stages of c…

items.title: The Role of Long Period Variable Stars in Observational Astrophysics
items.summary: arXiv:2601.19984v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Long-period variables (LPVs) are evolved red giant and supergiant stars whose pulsations provide unique insights into late stages of stellar evolution and serve as essential tools in modern astrophysics. Their period-luminosity and…

items.title: The CO snow line favours strong clumping by the streaming instability in protoplanetary discs with porous grains
items.summary: arXiv:2601.19985v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Context: The radial drift and fragmentation of small dust grains in protoplanetary discs impedes their growth past centimetre sizes. Several mechanisms have been proposed to overcome these planet formation barriers, such as dust por…

items.summary: arXiv:2601.19989v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We report the measurement of the R3=[O III]5008/Hb ratios for 54 galaxies in the GLIMPSE-D survey. Thanks to gravitational lensing, our sample includes galaxies with -20 < Muv < -14 at z=6-9. We derive oxygen abundances using calibr…
